instruction: What kinds of spectrum was used for detecting soil contaminated with Pb?
Output: The method developed for detecting soil contaminated with Pb used laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy (LIBS) spectrum.

instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used for detecting soil contaminated with Pb?
Output: PCA, PLS-DA, SVM, and DBN were used as spectral feature processing methods for detecting soil contaminated with Pb.

instruction: What metric was chosen to evaluate the classification performance of the deep belief network (DBN) for detecting soil contaminated with Pb?
Output: Accuracy was chosen as the metric to evaluate the classification performance of the deep belief network (DBN) for detecting soil contaminated with Pb.

instruction: What other machine learning models were compared to the deep belief network (DBN) in the classification of the LIBS data for detecting soil contaminated with Pb?
Output: The other machine learning models that were compared to the deep belief network (DBN) in the classification of the LIBS data for detecting soil contaminated with Pb are support vector machine (SVM) and partial least squares discriminant analysis (PLS-DA).

instruction: How does the proposed method using laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy (LIBS) compare to traditional methods in detecting soil contaminated with Pb (lead)?
Output: The proposed method using laser-induced breakdown spectroscopy (LIBS) was compared to traditional methods such as support vector machine (SVM) and partial least squares discriminant analysis (PLS-DA) in detecting soil contaminated with Pb (lead). The results showed that the method using LIBS with deep learning using a deep belief network (DBN) achieved satisfactory classification performance on all samples of contaminated soil. The robustness of the method was verified through the comparison with SVM and PLS-DA. The confusion matrix of the different algorithms indicated that the proposed method performed better on samples contaminated for four weeks compared to those contaminated for two weeks. Therefore, the proposed method using LIBS with deep learning showed promise in detecting heavy metals in soil, specifically Pb contamination.
